fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Our obituary of the Labour politician Gerald Kaufman (28 February, page 31) said he became assistant secretary of the Labour party after leaving the University of Oxford. He took up that post at the Fabian Society. The obituary also said that Richard Crossman edited the New Statesman in the early 1960s; he was editor from 1970 to 1972. • An article about Paul Weller’s clothing collection for mods said Baird Group, a menswear wholesaler, bought the UK rights to Ben Sherman from Marquee last year and is promoting a Ben Sherman spring range under the strapline “the spirit of mod”. Baird Group operates the Ben Sherman brand under licence from Marquee Brands. “The spirit of mod” is the name for the brand’s autumn range, not the spring one (Life in the old mod yet as Weller bids to expand brand, 25 February, page 23).
